headline: LEAX Group's Science-Based Targets Approved by SBTi — TradingView News

annotations.paragraph: LEAX is proud to announce that the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) has approved our near-term science-based emissions reduction targets. The SBTi is a leading organization that drives ambitious climate action in the private sector by enabling companies to set science-based emissions reduction targets.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides essential information about the approval of LEAX's targets by SBTi, which is central to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Our commitment represents a significant step towards a sustainable future. LEAX commits to reduce absolute scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions by 46.2% by 2030 from a 2019 base year. Additionally, we commit to increase active annual sourcing of renewable electricity from 67% in 2019 to 100% by 2030. Furthermore, we aim to reduce scope 3 GHG emissions from purchased goods and services by 55% per tonne of purchased goods by 2030 from a 2019 base year. Finally, LEAX commits that 100% of its customers by revenue covering use of sold products will have science-based targets by 2029.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides detailed information on LEAX's specific emissions reduction targets, which is directly relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: These targets highlight our unwavering commitment to reducing our environmental impact and contributing to global climate action. We are excited to continue our journey towards a sustainable future.

annotations.paragraph: LEAX Group AB (publ) is the parent company of a group ("LEAX Group") with about 1,000 employees. LEAX has operations in Köping, Falun and Falköping in Sweden, Riga and Rezekne in Latvia, Curitiba in Brazil, Detmold in Germany and Mezökövesd in Hungary. The Group designs, develops and industrializes advanced manufacturing solutions and superior products for global mobility and industrial markets. The Group had sales of SEK 2.0 billion in 2024.
